intro: Landolphia guianensis, commonly known as the giant arrowroot or arrowleaf, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces showy yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests.
